items.title: Police Clear Seattle’s Protest ‘Autonomous Zone’
items.abstract: The so-called Capitol Hill Organized Protest area was taken over by protesters after the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis. It was the site of at least four shootings last month.

items.title: Silicon Valley Dominating Self-Driving Tech? Motor City Says Not So Fast
items.abstract: Silicon Valley, with Google and Tesla, is developing the smart cars of tomorrow, but the Detroit Three are working hard on self-driving projects in Michigan.

items.title: Urban Planning Guru Says Driverless Cars Won’t Fix Congestion
items.abstract: Tech companies claim that autonomous vehicles could reduce traffic. But skeptics argue that they’ll add to gridlock if people are still taking solo trips.

items.title: Pave Over the Subway? Cities Face Tough Bets on Driverless Cars
items.abstract: Transit advocates fear that unrealistic hopes for new technology — and how soon it’ll get here — could lead cities down the wrong path.

items.title: Skype Founders Build a Robot for Suburban Streets
items.abstract: The entrepreneurs Ahti Heinla and Janus Friis are behind a Starship Technologies bot designed to make home deliveries.
